question.text: For above chemical reactions, identify the correct statement from the following:

options.text: Both compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>'</mo></math> and compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>'</mo></math> are dicarboxylic acids

Both compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>'</mo></math> and compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>'</mo></math> are diols

Compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>'</mo></math> is diol and compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>'</mo></math> is dicarboxylic acid

Compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>'</mo></math> is dicarboxylic acid and compound <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>'</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>'</mo></math> is diol

solution.text: KMnO4 in acidic medium is very strong oxidising agent due to which carboxylic acid is produced from alkene. KMnO4 in neutral medium is not very strong oxidising agent therefore, syn hydroxylation occurs and diol is produced from alkene.
